isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - 10 SPEED AND 15 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON RT, RTO, AND RTX SERIES - INSTALL - MAINSHAFT AUXILIARY DRIVE GEAR ASSEMBLIES

step1.para: Remove the auxiliary drive gear assembly from the mainshaft and rear bearing bore ( Figure 238). Do not allow the mainshaft to move to the rear when removing the auxiliary drive gear.

figure.caption: Figure 238. Remove Auxiliary Drive Gear Assembly From Mainshaft

step1.para: Move the reverse gear to the rear as far as possible, meshing teeth of the gear with those of the reverse idler gears ( Figure 239).

figure.caption: Figure 239. Mesh Reverse Gear Teeth with Reverse Idler Gear Teeth

step1.para: Align the external splines of the spacer with clutching teeth of the reverse gear and move the spacer forward on the mainshaft and into gear ( Figure 240).

figure.caption: Figure 240. Move Spacer Forward on Mainshaft

step1.para: Install the snap ring in the hub of the reverse gear and move the reverse gear forward on the mainshaft and into the proper position in the case ( Figure 241).

figure.caption: Figure 241. Install Snap Ring in Reverse Gear Hub

step1.para: Re-install the auxiliary drive gear assembly on the rear of the mainshaft ( Figure 242). Use a flanged-end driver and maul to seat the bearing in the case bore.

figure.caption: Figure 242. Re-Install Auxiliary Drive Gear Assembly on Rear of Mainshaft

step1.para: Align the six bolt holes in the retainer with the tapped holes in the case and install the bolts ( Figure 243). Tighten to 35 to 45 ft-lbs. (47 to 61 N·m) and lockwire the bolts in groups of three.
Install the snap ring in groove at the end of the mainshaft ( Figure 244).

figure.caption: Figure 244. Install Snap Ring in Groove at End of Mainshaft
